revised_title: Uniqueness and Solutions of the Bethe-Salpeter Equation for Scattering
tldr: The authors analyze the asymptotic behavior of solutions of the Bethe-Salpeter equation for scattering and investigate the conditions for unique, physically significant solutions. They examine the critical value of the coupling constant and determine it for states of any angular momentum and parity. The study focuses on meson-nucleon scattering and provides insights into the uniqueness of solutions in the context of nuclear physics.
